page.title: 14Towan Farm Well
page.content: Towan Farm Well is situated about half a mile past the farmhouse and is very hard to find.It is like a very small stone house with an archway.The inside drops about three feet down to the bottom which is now just mud.It is made out of Pentewan Stone,easily recognisable by the holes in the stone.At the back is a small carved shelf, possibly for throwing money and making wishes.Towan may have been inhabited as early as the Celtic period.There used to be a chapel there but the remains were taken down in 1777.The Holy Well still stands a little way away.It was restored by the St.Austell Old Cornwall Society and re-dedicated by Joseph Wellington Hunkin,who was Bishop of Truro, on the 10th June 1937,
